author: K.P. Smith
comment: Always minor bug fixes and improvements but never really any new features.  I've personally submitted multiple ideas for product improvement and I can only assume others have as well.  So they are either not capable of growing the platform or not willing.  Very disappointing.

author: Ryan Siew
comment: Wow. Been using it for 30 mins. This thing is completely useless. I try to link a Hue account through Google sign in and get 403 disallowed user agent. Linked my Arlo cams but can't actually live stream? Two integrations a compete failure. This will have to go back.

author: Jeff Cristofono
comment: What's with the clocking and sluggishness to control devices when on WiFi?  If I disconnect from my WiFi, I get no clocking in the app and great responsiveness of my devices.  On WiFi?  Spinning circle, up to a minute for devices to respond to commands.  This is new behavior for me, what gives?  Update: another update, another no fix for the clocking and poor device response on WiFi.    ***If you're considering Wink, I recommend you look at their competition until the very poor device response issue I and many others have is fixed.

author: Randy Sherwood
comment: What the hell did you do to the widget? You don't have enough distinct symbols to be able to get rid of the labels. I have no idea what each button does since they all look their same. Ridiculous.

reply.author: Wink App
reply.content:
Hey Randy, 

Can you send us an email to reviews@wink.com? We'd like to setup a call with a technician so we can get to the bottom of the connection issues you are experiencing. 

Your Friends at Wink

author: Jay Sciortino
comment: Another update, still no fix for major android wifi bug.  It's sad when the Alexa app operates switches more reliably than the manufacturer's own app.  Persistent bug causes devices to lag substantially, sometimes for a minute or more after toggling in Android app.  This occurs only when switching with the app on wifi connection, not mobile/lte connection.  This bug has been acknowledged by Wink team multiple times over the past year but for some reason they have not fixed it.

author: Christopher Antes
comment: Still no fix for location bots not working on Android Oreo Pixel 2 (same bots work on iPhone) - Having issues with location robots not working once upgrading to a Pixel 2 running Oreo. Have deleted and recreated the location bots but they still do not work. App needs to better support multiple users.

reply.author: Wink App
reply.content:
Hey Christopher, 

Activity should be shared among users... we'd love to get some further information from you if possible! Can you send us an email to reviews@wink.com? 

Your Friends at Wink

comment: Stability is poor. Using for 3 years and it looses connection with some of my lights. When a scheduled event fails, I get no notification. I arrive home and some of my lights will still be on after they should be off.

author: Richey Kirkpatrick
comment: No tablet app. No landscape mode.  Slow to respond.  Widgets are unreliable. Going to switch to a Samsung hub. MUCH BETTER REVIEWS online for that hub.  Update. Its gets worse

author: Tim Cook
comment: Constantly says it cannot communicate with the server. Works through Alexa but not their own app. Extremely dissatisfied with Wink. I will have to find a different home automation platform soon if this thing doesn't improve.

author: Ryan Gingerich
comment: 4x1 desktop shortcut has been messed up for at least the past month. While it still works, it looks like the images that make up the widget are offset in such a way that makes it difficult to see which button is which. Text is completely cut off. Please fix your desktop widgets Wink team!

reply.author: Wink App
reply.content:
Hey Ryan,

Can you give us a call to 1-844-Winkapp so we can get down to the bottom of this?

Your Friends at Wink

author: Bowtie Guy
comment: About 3 months in, no real issues. Main complaint for me is it's a massive storage hog, Currently using 600mb on my phone, literally the largest use of any of my 50+ installed apps .Ohterwise 4 stars...

author: Donn McKinney
comment: Great app.  However, since last update a few minutes ago, the icons on the multi shortcut widget are not lined up properly; they are a bit low!  I thank you for your help with this!

author: Dave B
comment: Had it for quite awhile. Things have gotten better over time. Temp doesn't keep changing to Celcius now! Motion sensors show Temp good also. Window and Door sensor work great. The only bad thing is wifi. It is slow as anything ever seen on wifi. If need to turn a light on/off it is much much much faster to turn wifi off on phone and use 4G. Having the phone on wifi and trying to do so is maddening. Notifications seem faster than trying to turn light off/on. But haven't timed it recently so can't say for sure. Except for the wifi, really like it. Fix the wifi slowness and get another star. Oh, forgot the Home Sitter Service. Don't really like cause if go to bed early it might turn a light on waking me up. You don't get an option to not turn something on after a certain time.
Its not the most intuitive app to, even the simplest automations take a lot of trial and error. Also please fix the wifi bug. App works very quickly on cellular, on WiFi all updates are very slow.

author: Justin Snyder
comment: I would happily rate this 5 stars but it's lacking 1 important feature that keeps driving me insane.    "Auto UNLOCK my door lock when I enter an area."  I am understanding that there are probably some legal limitations, but I feel like that could be remedied with a check box/"I understand" button at the bottom of a Zero Liability user notice. Special thanks to the great people of this world who would rather point the finger via a lawsuit than accept blame that they themselves actually messed something up.     The location feature for leaving an area works so well at locking my door, and August - using only Bluetooth to auto unlock my door - typically leaves me standing at my door like an awkward nut for 30 seconds waiting for it to connect.  Auto unlock via this app would make the process that much better.  Everything about this Wink app is otherwise wonderful.  You have done an amazing job integrating multiple aspects of a smart home that are even useful before you have a large group of smart products.  1 or 2 things is all you need for this app to become a necessity!

author: Bruno Ruiz De Somocurcio
comment: Contantly loosing connection the Hue account, not to mention the huge delay between hitting a widget for a scene and having the action take place. There is also a lack of Icons to use for lights and they are never updated. If you have mostly Hue lights go with Gideon. THANKS Will.I.AM.

author: Clowndagging Donkeynuts
comment: Been still waiting on were send my hub for repair n still no respond back sent over 10 emails n still no repay once I finally talk to someone they don't even stand by there product so don't buy there stuff

author: Jose Miceli
comment: The app is very delayed. I can turn a light off on the app but it takes a minute for the light to actually turn off.
You cannot link your Philips Hue account if you sign in with your Google account

author: Joe Madison
comment: Will not connect to devices when I'm connected to my Wi-Fi. Update did not fix this, might have actually made it worse.

author: Gary Ladue
comment: Doesn't see phillips hue switches or motion, temp,lux, sensors...

author: scott mickle
comment: Pretty good, a better ui for 5 stars. It does what I need it to.

author: junior arevalo
comment: grate app a most have

reply.author: Wink App
reply.content:
Hey Junior,

Thanks for the update! Let us know if there is anything we can assist you with in the future!

Your Friends at Wink

author: Robert Blevins
comment: Easy to use, quick to configure.

author: John Feil
comment: Works great!

author: Sean Pennington
comment: What happened to the shortcuts widget? It takes a half century for a light to come on using it. It used to be very quick. Now when you hit your desired selection the loading sign spins and it says activating..... Forever. Please resolve this issue. This is of great convenience as opposed to going into the app, finding your selection, etc. Other than that everything responds very quickly(through the app and other third parties, Alexa, assistant, etc.)

author: Maurice Jones Jr.
comment: I like how the app is laid out and how it brings everything together. The app is easy to use.  The wifi lag is bad. The issue with the devices reporting incorrect status shouldn't be there either. When I use an Amazon Echo to turn a device on/off there is no lag.  It would be nice to be able to have the Moon Light be able to turn a switch on (in wall light switch for instance) that controls a light instead of having to use a Robot. As it stands now, you can only use Moon Light with a smart light bulb.

author: Alastair Mayo
comment: Turning on a light from this app can sometimes take 20 seconds to actually happen. If you connect Google Assistant to Wink and tell it to turn on a light it happens instantly. Why is the actual Wink app so ****in slow?! They seem to be totally incapable of fixing this, as it's been this way forever.

reply.author: Wink App
reply.content:
Hey Alastair,

Thanks for the update! We'll be sure to take a closer look at what's going on with the lag, let us know if you notice any other weirdness. 

Your Friends at Wink

author: Todd Phelan
comment: 12/23/17 The responsiveness of the Android Wink app, while on WiFi, is not acceptable. Apparently this has been a known issue for quite some time but no solution has been implemented.    7/25/17  Wink has grown a lot and has become more reliable with time. I'd love to have more icon choices for devices.

reply.author: Wink App
reply.content:
Hey Todd,

Thanks for the review! So glad to hear how far your Wink system has come and we can't wait to see what you connect next. 

Your Friends at Wink

author: Mike Stankovich
comment: I want to like the app but as others said it can take 20 seconds to perform an action in the app while it seems like it is is polling status. The hue app is instant. Devices that are zigbee and zwave should be instant from the wink hub 2. Doesn't work with the latest version of Chamberlain myq controller. robots need more logic, currently things are too simple. There needs to be a way to set up IFTTT service, what is currently offered doesnt allow the hub to be an If trigher

author: michael bolyard
comment: Latest update is terrible. I have had the same 5 shortcuts(living room lights on, sitting room lights on, all lights off, door lock, door unlock) on my home screen for well over a year with no problems. Now, with the latest update, all of the shortcuts have changed themselves to be "door unlock" widgets. They still show the correct icon for the shortcut that's supposed to be in that spot. However they all say "door unlock" underneath and unlock the door when pressed. I reset them all to the correct shortcuts twice and they turn themselves back into "door unlock" within 2 days.

author: Eddie Toro
comment: Apple version is near flawless...this Android version, not so much. My biggest issue is that notifications will not display unless the app is open in the background. I don't know if that's a Android or Wink issue. The app is also slower than it was on my iPhone, I've had a similar experience to other reviewers with the slow spinning circle. I'm running Android 7. Otherwise, I don't regret having Wink, it's 1000 times better than ADT pulse!

reply.author: Wink App
reply.content:
Hey Eddie,

That's an interesting find. Can you give us a call to 1-844-Winkapp or send us an email to reviews@wink.com so we can further investigate this issue you're having with your notifications? 

Your Friends at Wink

author: Christophe Buron
comment: Could do better. Useful and mostly functional. Still has a long long long way to go to become the standard in home automation. App does not always sync properly with hub and does not 100% recognise the on/off status of lights. Home sitter service appears to be broken, only allowing two lights to be included. Robots could use an improved logic and multiple triggers. Compatibility with devices - especialy zwave - is quite limitted.

App is not responsive most of the time. When using Wink app half of the lights in my house do not respond. If I use Alexa to control my lights they respond almost instantly. With Wink app if they do choose to respond it's usually with a 15-30 second lag.

author: Drew Partridge
comment: Still dealing with constant lag on WiFi. 30-60 second delay before you can control lights each time the app is opened. This has been ongoing for 6+ months. No issues on cellular network.

author: R
comment: The app and the hub 2 are great when they work. But the lag over wi-fi is unbearable at times - taking as much as 20 seconds for processing any command. Sometimes it doesn't work at all. Works fine over cellular data. Hope they fix this soon. Would give a 5 star review if it wasn't for this.

author: Daren Barker
comment: Terrible on Android!!! Widgets don't work and just spin. This has been going on forever. Whoever the actual Product Manager of the Wink app is, isn't even addressing or commenting to their customers and should be fired.  This tells me the whole company must be having major issues and is giving up. I used this app every day on my iPhone till I bought a Samsung S8.  The IOS version by the way still works just fine on my wife's phone. But Im screwed now and no longer trust Wink and regret my investment in their product line.

author: Steve Weinberg
comment: This was a poorly-designed app, with a bizarre and un-intuitive user interface when it first came out.  It hasn't improved at all over the past year.  The December 2017 release is now so awful, that it crashes upon opening, every time.  It really is utterly useless as an app to actually turn things on and off, or dim things, etc.  It's much easier to just use Alexa or Google Assistant.  Whoever at Wink is responsible for this piece of work needs to be fired.

author: Matt H.
comment: This is the worst home automation system I have ever used. Absolute garbage compared to Insteon. Lights report incorrect status if they will stay connected to the hub. Resetting the hub resolves nothing except none of the lights will pair anymore.

author: Allen Simmons
comment: Still haven't fixed the lights delayed response when on Wi-Fi. I've deleted/reinstalled app countless times but problem always come back. Fine on mobile data.
